item.title: How to Disable the Touchpad in Linux?
item.description: Have you ever been annoyed by accidentally touching the touchpad on your laptop when you are typing? I am using a Linux laptop with both trackpoint and touchpad so the touchpad is just an annoying redundant thing. Here is the one-liner to disable it: xinput list | grep TouchPad | grep -Po 'id=\K([0-9]+)' | xargs xinput disable
